Comment: > The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) announced actions Tuesday to phase out the use of petroleum-based food dyes in U.S. food products, citing concerns over potential health impacts on children. >  > FDA Commissioner Martin Makary in remarks Tuesday pointed to studies that linked petroleum-based dyes to ADHD, obesity, diabetes, insulin resistance and cancer. He announced the FDA would be initiating a plan to revoke the authorization of the synthetic food colorings Citrus Red 2 and Orange B. >  > Citrus Red is only approved for use in coloring orange peels, and Orange B is only approved for use in hot dog and sausage casings. >  > Additionally, Makary said the FDA would take steps to remove other synthetic dyes off the market including Red Dye 40, Yellow No. 5, Yellow No. 6, Blue No. 1, Blue No. 2 and Green No. 3 by the end of 2026. >  > ‚ÄúAmerica‚Äôs children are sick and suffering. Forty-one percent of children have at least have at least one health condition, and 1 in 5 are on medication,‚Äù Makary said. ‚ÄúThe answer is not more Ozempic, more ADHD medication and more antidepressants. There‚Äôs a role for those medications, but we have to look at underlying root causes.‚Äù >  > **Health and Human Services (HHS) Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. commended food companies for working with the government on what he called an ‚Äúunderstanding‚Äù to phase out these synthetic food dyes**. Kennedy said there was no agreement in place and did not disclose any penalties when asked about repercussions against food companies that decide not to voluntarily remove petroleum food dyes from their products.  Wait, did he accidentally do something that's not terrible?

Comment: Chef here, Oranges when they're left out in the sun a bit too long they turn green ( perfectly acceptable to eat still ) however people think they're bad. So if dye is used to make the fruit look a more vibrant shade of orange people will think that they're juicier, sweeter or a better quality orange. Similar to why salmon is dyed pink.   Here in Australia we have a tonne of food waste due to the beauty standard of food ( of its not a victorias secret model its not worth eating ) I would assume it would be similar for you which is why you would dye the fruit orange ( able to sell more produce than toss the shittier fruit or give them to food banks/farmers for live stock )¬†
